config_description: Compression to apply to the commit log. If omitted, the commit log will be written uncompressed.  LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate compressors are supported.
developer_understanding_on_working: The 'commitlog_compression' configuration is used to specify the compression to apply to the commit log. The code initializes the CommitLog object with the compression configuration obtained from DatabaseDescriptor. The supported compressors are LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The 'commitlog_compression' configuration is triggered when the CommitLog object is initialized. This typically happens when the system starts up or when the configuration is reset for testing purposes.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'commitlog_compression' configuration option on the system is in terms of storage space and performance. Compressing the commit log can reduce the storage space required but may introduce some overhead in terms of CPU usage for compression and decompression operations.
